meaningMnemonic:
Adding an お in front and a さん behind <kanji>miss</kanji> makes for a very respectful way of addressing a<vocabulary>young lady</vocabulary>. It can also be used to refer to somebody’s <vocabulary>daughter</vocabulary> in a polite manner.

Note that older generations tend to use this word to directly address a young woman. But be careful when doing this yourself, as it might come across as overly formal!
readingMnemonic: The reading of 嬢 is the same as the one you learned for the kanji, meaning you should already know it!
